page.title: 01RURAL LAND EAST OF HASLEMERE
page.content: This is an area of undulating woodland and farmland in rural Surrey. there are few roads, no railways and no towns or villages. The few scattered houses and farms are the only settlements. Mixed farming is the main occupation. Much of the remaining land is covered by mixed woods including some managed by the Forestry Commissiion. There are no manmade recreational facilities in the area except the Lythe Hill Hotel, which offers two restaurants and accommodation and one other public house. There are several lakes in the area used by anglers, and the countryside offers many pleasant walks with opportunities to see the plentiful roe deer. In l985 this is a prosperous area and home for many who commute to London and surrounding towns to work.
